bug.short_desc: [Regression] detaching tab gives strange small size terminal
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: in 3.18.x, detaching a tab from a tab group inherits the old size. Now, the newly created separate terminal is a strange 20x1 -ish size terminal.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): gnome-terminal-3.20.2-2.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Configure gnome-terminal to open new in tabs. 2. open some new tabs 3. choose to detach one of the tabs from the menu.
Actual results: The newly created separate terminal is of a strange small size.
Expected results: new terminal to have old size of the tab.
Additional info: I like to work in a mixture of tab groups and separate terminals.

Still at: gnome-terminal-3.20.2-2.fc24.x86_64
Through chance, I discovered that the older behavior, and the desired one, of detaching to a new terminal of the original size, can be achieved by click-dragging the tab above the terminal to a blank area of the desktop.
It seems very strange that detaching via menu->tabs->"Detach Terminal" behaves differently from click-dragging the tab above the terminal.
also wondering if these messages in /var/log/messages (or journalctl -b -a...) are related?
Sep 24 08:16:40 localhost gnome-terminal-server: (gnome-terminal-server:2075): Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size to GtkScrollbar 0x55706c2e49b0 with out calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate? Sep 24 08:14:51 localhost gnome-terminal-server: (gnome-terminal-server:2075): Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size to GtkScrollbar 0x55706c2e49b0 with out calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate? Sep 24 08:14:51 localhost gnome-terminal-server: (gnome-terminal-server:2075): Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size to GtkScrollbar 0x55706c2e49b0 with out calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate? Sep 24 08:14:50 localhost gnome-terminal-server: (gnome-terminal-server:2075): Gtk-WARNING **: Allocating size to GtkScrollbar 0x55706c2e49b0 with out calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate?

Just upgraded to gnome-terminal-3.20.3-1.fc24.x86_64 vte-0.28.2-17.fc24.x86_64 and tried it again - the problem is gone.
The pile of messages about 'GtkScrollbar 0x55706c2e49b0 with out calling gtk_widget_get_preferred_width/height(). How does the code know the size to allocate?' still happens.
There is another regression - dragging the tab out to detach no longer works. But I could live without that, when detach from menu keeps the current size.
